listitem.para: Master-ID of the Master Interface. Has to be zero or a positive integer.
Working Domain ID for the working slave. Default zero or a positive integer.
Alternative slave addressing possibillity, see Slave Position. Zero or a positive 16 Bit integer.
Slave position in the ethercat bus. Zero or a positive integer
When ticked, causes an extra output for each channel of the block. The extra output carries a bit pattern. The location an meaning of the bits can be found in the Beckhoff Slave Documentation.

This enables the filter in the slave. As there is currently no means provided to set the filter time, the default filter setting of 50Hz is in effect. For further Information please read the Beckhoff Slave Documentation.

Denotes the type of thermocouple connected to the channel. This setting ensures the correct temperature to be output. The bottom settings denote modes for reading low voltages without temperature translation. For further Information please read the Beckhoff Slave Documentation.

Denotes where the data for the Cold Jucntion temperature comes from. For details please read the Beckhoff Slave Documentation. Note that setting this value to "External" causes an input to appear on the block where the Cold Junction temperature must be provided.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This Block represents an EL33xx Beckhoff EtherCAT Slave. You can access Fieldbus IO during Simulation and after Codegeneration in standalone running mode

The settings influence the number of ports on the block. There is at least one TC value output port for each channel delivering the temperature (or milliVolts). If the "Enable Statusport" is ticked, an extra output for each channel delivers the status bit pattern. All Statusport outputs are grouped together below the TC value output ports. If a channel's Cold Junction is set to "External data" an input is added that accepts the cold junction temperature.
